amendatorysection.para: An individual may transfer property to one or more beneficiaries effective at the transferor's death by a transfer on death deed. If the property is agricultural land, the transferor may designate in the transfer on death deed the disposition of the transferor's interest in growing crops to the transferor's estate or to one or more of the designated beneficiaries. If the property is agricultural land and the transfer on death deed does not contain a designation of the disposition of the transferor's interest in growing crops, the transferor's interest in the growing crops shall pass to the transferor's estate.
